snippet: An end to the relative calm in rebel-held areas of the city came a day after President Vladimir V. Putin and President-elect Donald J. Trump agreed to bolster cooperation....
abstract: Russia begins major new aerial offensive against rebels in Aleppo, Syria, shattering relative calm that has prevailed over three weeks.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and IVAN NECHEPURENKO
byline.contributor: Anne Barnard reported from Beirut, and Ivan Nechepurenko from Moscow. Reporting was contributed by Neil MacFarquhar from Moscow, Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Maher Samaan from Paris, Sewell Chan from London, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: An end to the relative calm in rebel-held areas of the city came a day after President Vladimir V. Putin and President-elect Donald J. Trump agreed to bolster cooperation.

headline.main: Airstrikes on Aleppo Resume as Russia Begins New Offensive in Syria
headline.print_headline: In Syria, a New Russian Offensive and Strikes on Aleppo

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
